pageContext.claim: “China, as a sign of goodwill, has agreed to purchase a tremendous, massive amount of soybeans and other agricultural product. Our farmers, this morning, are very happy. I spoke to Sonny Perdue, Secretary of Agriculture. He called me this morning. Our farmers are extremely happy.”
pageContext.analysis: China had agreed to make a one-time purchase of 5 million tons of soybeans. (The purchase three weeks after this comment was boosted to 10 million.) But this is relatively small given that China used to buy 30 to 35 million tons of soybeans a year before Trump launched his trade war. The proposed Chinese purchase amounts to 3.6 percent of the total U.S. production.
